job_title: Service Ambassador in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Nice coworkers, easy job, fun
cons: Low pay, scheduled for 5 am shifts

job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Small, old and outdated community hospital. It is a great place to start as a new grad gain some years of experience and move on. This should only be a stepping stone. Some units have great coworkers that will help. The unit culture really depends on the coworkers and charge during that shift, like everywhere else. Pay is decent but should be more.
cons: reaching doctors at night. Some doctors are rude if you ask them to report verbal or phone orders, which is ridiculous. Nurses have to call doctors to get admission or any orders then we have to put them in. That is a liability. Doctors should put in their own orders unless it’s stat orders. Not able to chose your schedule. Management just schedules you whenever they want and when you try to switch you get a passive aggressive response as to why you are switching so much.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Good team work and hard workers
cons: The hospital hires new grads or young nurses who don't have an experience and give them an orientation as usual . It's ok but the big problem is that they don't stay and work at this hospital long. This causes long term short staffing. We don't have a charge nurse sometimes and of course always no relief nurse. The management? It's terrible. They are always pushing for discharge patients and admit the patients. It is difficult to focus on all of patients. Feeling unsafe and sorry for the patients.
